00:00:01:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:01:190000.Dialogue: So, Bernadette, how goes the hunt for bridesmaid dresses?

00:00:04:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:04:110000.Dialogue: Well, if you don't mind looking like an orange traffic cone, great.

00:00:07:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:07:200000.Dialogue: Girlfriends, I have the answer to our dress problems.

00:00:12:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:12:190000.Dialogue: 12 years ago, my cousin Irene and her entire family died in a horrific carbon monoxide accident the night before her wedding.

00:00:25:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:25:140000.Dialogue: All those bridesmaids dresses remain unused and available to us for free.

00:00:29:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:29:180000.Dialogue: So it seems that cloud of odorless deadly gas had a silver lining after all. Check it out, still in the bags. The gowns, not the bridesmaids.

00:00:42:120000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:42:120000.Dialogue: I don't know. Dead people's dresses?

00:00:49:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:49:070000.Dialogue: Oh, I was hoping you wouldn't notice. Irene was always a slave to a good bargain when it came to clothes, and sadly as it turned out, space heaters.

00:00:58:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:58:090000.Dialogue: Ladies, please. These four walls once housed an intellectual salon where the mind received nourishment as well as the stomach. But through no one's fault, Penny,

00:01:11:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:11:020000.Dialogue: the quality of dinner conversation in this apartment has declined. And again, I'm looking at no one in particular, Penny.

00:01:21:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:21:130000.Dialogue: Fine. What would you like to talk about, Sheldon?

00:01:24:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:24:070000.Dialogue: What would you like to talk about, Sheldon? Why do you hate us?

00:01:30:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:30:050000.Dialogue: I've prepared a number of topics that should appeal to both the advanced and novice conversationalists.

00:01:35:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:35:160000.Dialogue: Okay, that time you looked at me.

00:01:38:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:38:150000.Dialogue: Who didn't? Your skin is like alabaster. Do you even have pores?

00:01:46:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:46:010000.Dialogue: Faster-than-light particles at CERN-- paradigm-shifting discovery or another Swiss export as full of holes as their cheese? And converse.

00:01:56:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:56:070000.Dialogue: All right, who wants to go to my apartment and look at bridal magazines?

00:02:00:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:00:180000.Dialogue: Through no one's fault, Sheldon, we're leaving.

00:02:09:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:09:040000.Dialogue: Sheldon, sometimes you forget, I'm a lady. And with that comes an estrogen-fueled need to page through thick glossy magazines that make me hate my body.

00:02:22:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:22:050000.Dialogue: New topic: women. Delightfully mysterious or bat-crap crazy?

00:02:28:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:28:050000.Dialogue: Totally. What's wrong with cap sleeves? If you have the right figure for it, they're adorable.

00:03:02:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:02:080000.Dialogue: Hey, Amy, what brings you to our neck of the woods?

00:03:05:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:05:050000.Dialogue: Your neurology department loaned me a culture of prions for my research on bovine spongiform encephalopathy.

00:03:14:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:14:140000.Dialogue: She popped by to borrow a cup of mad cow disease.

00:03:20:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:20:130000.Dialogue: It's hard to make degenerative brain maladies hilarious, and yet somehow you do it.

00:03:26:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:26:170000.Dialogue: That's fun to have in a lunchroom.

00:03:28:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:28:220000.Dialogue: The real fun starts when you get to pick the rat you're going to feed it to, and maybe you choose the beady-eyed little mother who's been biting you all week.

00:03:36:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:36:010000.Dialogue: Please, we're eating. Can we get that off the table and change the subject?

00:03:44:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:44:060000.Dialogue: while I turn this conversation into a conver-sensation.

00:03:52:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:52:030000.Dialogue: I have 100 alphabetized topics from artichoke-- come on, people, it's just a giant thistle, to zzz-- the onamona-poetry of sleep.

00:04:02:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:02:220000.Dialogue: Amy, how long would it take for that mad cow disease to kill me?

00:04:07:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:07:220000.Dialogue: I don't know, four or five years.

00:04:11:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:11:110000.Dialogue: No, it's not gonna do it.

00:04:16:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:16:210000.Dialogue: Oy. Bernadette keeps texting me pictures of Penny in bridesmaid dresses.

00:04:32:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:32:010000.Dialogue: Why are they asking me about this stuff? What guy knows what a sweetheart neckline is?

00:04:48:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:48:220000.Dialogue: Leonard's coming down the home stretch!

00:04:54:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:54:200000.Dialogue: Come on, horsey, you can do this!

00:04:58:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:58:220000.Dialogue: Damn. Come on, thigh muscles, you can do this!

00:05:03:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:03:140000.Dialogue: Yes! First place. I would have been a great jockey if I weren't too tall.

00:05:11:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:11:120000.Dialogue: And scared of horses. Sheldon, you're up.

00:05:16:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:16:150000.Dialogue: Come on, it's your turn. We said we'd get more fresh air.

00:05:20:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:20:080000.Dialogue: Sorry. I'm a little distracted. I can't seem to get in touch with Amy. I tried e-mail, video chat, tweeting her, posting on her Facebook wall, texting her, nothing.

00:05:31:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:31:060000.Dialogue: Did you try calling her on the telephone?

00:05:39:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:39:110000.Dialogue: You know, Leonard, in your own simple way, you may be the wisest of us all.

00:05:50:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:50:220000.Dialogue: If you're worried, we can go over there and see if she's all right.

00:05:53:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:53:200000.Dialogue: Okay. You know, I heard in the news a bobcat has been spotted in her neighborhood.

00:06:00:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:00:100000.Dialogue: I don't think Amy was eaten by a bobcat.

00:06:03:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:03:070000.Dialogue: Who thinks Amy was eaten by a bobcat?

00:06:08:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:08:150000.Dialogue: Leonard, I was just mentioning an interesting local news item. Now, thanks to you, I'm worried Amy's been eaten by a bobcat.

00:06:15:210000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:15:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:17:230000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:17:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:17:230000.Dialogue: How can I? You won't stop talking about it!

00:06:43:010000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:43:010000.Speaker: Amy

00:06:45:010000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:45:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:45:010000.Dialogue: She sounds weepy. I don't like weepy. Let's go.

00:06:47:230000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:47:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:47:230000.Dialogue: Uh... She's your friend. Step up. Amy. Amy. Amy.

00:06:56:010000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:56:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:57:140000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:57:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:58:170000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:06:58:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:58:170000.Dialogue: I'm single, I don't need this crap.

00:07:03:170000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:03:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:03:170000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what are you doing here?

00:07:05:020000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:05:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:05:020000.Dialogue: You didn't respond to any of my electronic communications.

00:07:08:040000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:08:040000.Speaker: Amy

00:07:12:180000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:12:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:12:180000.Dialogue: Would you like to talk about it? And keep in mind that no is a perfectly viable answer.

00:07:19:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:19:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:19:160000.Dialogue: Sheldon, my world is crumbling around me.

00:07:23:000000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:23:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:23:000000.Dialogue: Point of order. As you're in distress, it would be customary for me to offer you a hot beverage.

00:07:31:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:31:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:31:160000.Dialogue: But I'm a guest in your home, so it would be customary for you to offer me a beverage.

00:07:38:060000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:38:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:38:060000.Dialogue: How do you want to proceed vis-à-vis beverages?

00:07:41:230000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:41:230000.Speaker: Amy

00:07:46:190000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:46:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:46:190000.Dialogue: If you'd like to take your mind off what's troubling you, uh, word on the street is a bobcat has been spotted.

00:07:55:230000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:55:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:55:230000.Dialogue: Penny and Bernadette went shopping for bridesmaids dresses without me.

00:07:59:190000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:07:59:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:59:190000.Dialogue: And that made you feel... sad?

00:08:05:110000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:05:110000.Speaker: Amy

00:08:07:010000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:07:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:09:170000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:09:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:09:170000.Dialogue: Just keep going. I guess I'm good at this.

00:08:14:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:14:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:14:120000.Dialogue: It's just, I thought they liked hanging out with me, but I guess I was fooling myself.

00:08:19:060000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:19:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:19:060000.Dialogue: When they were over here, did you fail to offer them a beverage?

00:08:27:020000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:27:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:27:020000.Dialogue: 'Cause I can see how that could stick in someone's craw.

00:08:30:180000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:30:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:30:180000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm going to ask you something, and I'd like you to keep an open mind.

00:08:36:000000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:36:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:37:090000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:37:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:37:090000.Dialogue: At this moment, I find myself craving human intimacy and physical contact.

00:08:42:180000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:42:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:48:000000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:48:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:48:000000.Dialogue: You know ours is a relationship of the mind.

00:08:51:220000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:08:51:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:51:220000.Dialogue: Proposal. One wild night of torrid lovemaking that soothes my soul and inflames my loins.

00:09:03:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:03:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:06:050000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:06:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:06:050000.Dialogue: I will gently stroke your head and repeat, Aw, who's a good Amy

00:09:16:010000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:16:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:16:010000.Dialogue: How about this? French kissing-- seven minutes in heaven culminating in second base.

00:09:27:110000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:27:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:32:050000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:32:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:40:130000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:40:130000.Speaker: Amy

00:09:43:170000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:43:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:52:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:09:52:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:16:090000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
00:10:16:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:16:090000.Dialogue: I'm just saying, second base is right there.

00:10:26:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:26:150000.Dialogue: Mm, I'm thinking about adopting some quirky affectation, like a pipe or a monocle or a handlebar mustache.

00:10:34:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:34:160000.Dialogue: For all those girls out there looking for the Indian Monopoly man?

00:10:43:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:43:100000.Dialogue: This is not a safe place. You can't share anything here.

00:10:49:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:49:050000.Dialogue: The two of you need to get your women in line!

00:10:55:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:55:230000.Dialogue: Last night I was strong-armed into an evening of harp music and spooning with an emotional Amy Farrah Fowler. This on a night that I had originally designated for solving the space-time geometry in higher-spin gravity and building my Lego Death Star.

00:11:11:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:11:010000.Dialogue: And why? Your gal pals, Penny and Bernadette, went out shopping for some wedding nonsense without Amy, an action they took with no thought or regard as to how it would affect me, the future of string theory or my Lego fun time!

00:11:26:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:26:000000.Dialogue: What do you want us to do about it?

00:11:27:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:27:200000.Dialogue: You clearly weren't listening to my topic sentence: Get your women in line!

00:11:33:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:33:050000.Dialogue: You make them apologize to Amy and set things right. I am a man of science, not someone's snuggle bunny!

00:11:38:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:38:150000.Dialogue: Why do I have to talk to Penny? She's not my girlfriend.

00:11:42:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:42:160000.Dialogue: You invited her to lunch four years ago. Everything about her is on you; you make it so!

00:11:53:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:53:130000.Dialogue: He was up late last night, so I gave him an early dinner and put him to bed.

00:11:59:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:59:150000.Dialogue: Yeah, but now he's gonna be up at dawn and want to play.

00:12:04:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:04:210000.Dialogue: So, listen, guys, the reason he was up late is because he was taking care of Amy. She's kind of upset.

00:12:11:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:11:230000.Dialogue: Her feelings got hurt because you guys went dress shopping without her.

00:12:15:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:15:010000.Dialogue: I told you that would happen.

00:12:17:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:17:010000.Dialogue: Okay, look, this is her first time being a bridesmaid and she's just getting a little crazy with it.

00:12:21:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:21:170000.Dialogue: She keeps on telling us stories about bridesmaid traditions in other cultures, and they're all about getting naked and washing each other.

00:12:35:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:35:160000.Dialogue: Yeah, and she keeps trying to figure out if our cycles have synced up so we can call ourselves The Three Menstra-Teers

00:12:44:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:44:190000.Dialogue: We thought it would be easier to look at dresses one time without her. I feel terrible.

00:12:49:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:49:210000.Dialogue: I know. Me, too. We'll talk to her. Hey, wait, how did she find out?

00:12:59:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:59:090000.Dialogue: And he says he would do it again.

00:13:04:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:04:090000.Dialogue: Hey, I'm sorry. You sent me the picture; I wasn't thinking.

00:13:24:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:24:070000.Dialogue: Hold on, did you talk about us when we were dating?

00:13:26:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:26:020000.Dialogue: No. All your little secrets are fine.

00:13:43:220000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:13:43:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:43:220000.Dialogue: Come on, tumor. Come on, tumor, Mama needs an aggressive little glioblastoma.

00:13:52:190000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:13:52:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:52:190000.Dialogue: Yay, brain tumor! Probably not the same reaction you had when you got the news.

00:14:01:020000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:01:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:03:140000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:03:140000.Speaker: Amy

00:14:05:040000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:05:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:05:040000.Dialogue: Well, look, we just wanted to apologize for not bringing you with us the other day.

00:14:09:120000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:09:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:09:120000.Dialogue: That's not necessary-- it's like Sesame Street says: One of these things is not like the other, one of these things should die alone.

00:14:17:230000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:17:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:17:230000.Dialogue: Come on, Amy, let us make it up to you. We'll have a girl's night; we'll do whatever you want.

00:14:23:050000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:23:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:23:050000.Dialogue: We can go down to the Korean baths and do that thing you were talking about where we wash each other.

00:14:29:150000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:29:150000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:33:170000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:33:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:33:170000.Dialogue: It's okay. I'm glad this happened. I can stop pretending that some beautiful girl and her cute-in- the-right-light friend want to hang out with me.

00:14:42:060000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:42:060000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:14:44:080000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:44:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:45:230000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:45:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:45:230000.Dialogue: Don't. I'll be okay. You're not the first girls I thought were friends with me who ended up shunning me. It's like elementary school, junior high, high school, undergrad, grad school, and that semester abroad in Norway all over again.

00:14:58:010000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:14:58:010000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:00:110000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:15:00:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:00:110000.Dialogue: You don't get it. Look at this brain.

00:15:04:030000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:15:04:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:06:230000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:15:06:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:06:230000.Dialogue: This is us. Bernadette, you are the analytical, scientific left hemisphere. Penny, you're the creative, spontaneous right hemisphere. And where's Amy? She's right here-- the sad little tumor no one wants to go dress shopping with.

00:15:25:230000.Scene: Amy’s lab. Amy is dissecting a brain.
00:15:25:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:25:230000.Dialogue: Amy, you're not a tumor. Penny, tell her she's not a tumor.

00:15:40:160000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:15:40:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:40:160000.Dialogue: Did you know that when Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone, he proposed answering it with ahoy?

00:15:49:130000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:15:49:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:52:190000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:15:52:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:52:190000.Dialogue: I like it. Amy? Is that you? Have you been drinking? I'm sorry, I bet my sweet what?

00:16:04:210000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:16:04:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:04:210000.Dialogue: Well, all right. We're on our way.

00:16:07:120000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:16:07:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:09:050000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:16:09:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:09:050000.Dialogue: It would seem Amy is drunk in a liquor store parking lot.

00:16:13:210000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:16:13:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:15:090000.Scene: The apartment, Sheldon is building his Lego Death Star. Phone rings.
00:16:15:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:15:090000.Dialogue: Leonard, be glad you can't keep a woman. They are a handful.

00:16:25:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:25:160000.Dialogue: Oh, look. It's Sheldon and little Leonard. Hi, little Leonard.

00:16:37:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:37:050000.Dialogue: Yes, Cuddles. We cuddled. Grow up, Leonard.

00:16:42:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:42:180000.Dialogue: Amy, what are you doing here?

00:16:50:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:50:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, but why didn't you go back to your apartment?

00:16:53:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:53:190000.Dialogue: Didn't you go to high school, Leonard? Parking lots are where all the cool kids hang out. Not that the rat bastards ever invited me.

00:17:01:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:01:190000.Dialogue: Maybe we should get you home.

00:17:03:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:03:080000.Dialogue: Oh, hang on, hang on, hang on. Sheldon, what would it take for you to go into that liquor store, buy a bottle of hooch, take me across the street to that motel, and have your way with me?

00:17:17:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:17:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, Sheldon, what would it take?

00:17:23:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:23:080000.Dialogue: I'm begging both of you, please, let's go.

00:17:29:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:29:080000.Dialogue: Whee! Ooh, finally someone found second base.

00:17:38:120000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:17:38:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:38:120000.Dialogue: I know how you feel. I got a knife slicing through my frontal lobe, too.

00:17:46:040000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:17:46:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:47:220000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:17:47:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:47:220000.Dialogue: What do you want? Do you want me to give the friendship bracelet back?

00:17:51:150000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:17:51:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:51:150000.Dialogue: I never gave you a friendship bracelet.

00:17:54:190000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:17:54:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:54:190000.Dialogue: When we first met, I made one and pretended you gave it to me. You can have it back if you want.

00:18:00:120000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:00:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:00:120000.Dialogue: No, you made that for you; I want you to have it.

00:18:06:130000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:06:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:06:130000.Dialogue: We know you're upset, and you have every right to be, but if it's okay with you, we'd like a second chance to make things right.

00:18:12:050000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:12:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:12:050000.Dialogue: We are really sorry, and we were trying to think of some way to show you how much we care about you.

00:18:17:210000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:17:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:17:210000.Dialogue: Which is why it would mean so much if you would agree to be the maid of honor at my wedding.

00:18:22:220000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:22:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:22:220000.Dialogue: What? Wait, is this some kind of practical joke? Like in Norway, when my friends trapped me in a sauna with a horny otter?

00:18:34:160000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:34:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:34:160000.Dialogue: No. I-I want you to be the maid of honor.

00:18:38:080000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:38:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:38:080000.Dialogue: Oh, my gosh. No one's every asked me to be the maid of honor before. Well, that's not true. Once, but then they all died.

00:18:47:210000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:47:210000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:18:50:060000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:18:50:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:50:060000.Dialogue: Yes. Yes. Oh, my gosh, I-I have so much to do. There's the bridal shower and the bachelorette party. What should we do for the bachelorette party? Oh, I know-- we'll go to a Native American sweat lodge, we'll take peyote, roll around in the mud, and paint fertility symbols on Bernadette's naked body. So that's happening.

00:19:07:230000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:19:07:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:07:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, sure, sure. Vegas is fun, too.

00:19:12:160000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:19:12:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:12:160000.Dialogue: I feel like crying. Of course, I could just be hormonal. Oh, wait. Maybe our menses are finally syncing up. Bernadette? No? Penny?

00:19:19:230000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:19:19:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:19:21:140000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:19:21:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:19:22:130000.Scene: Amy’s lab. She is dissecting a brain.
00:19:22:130000.Speaker: Amy

00:19:33:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:33:040000.Dialogue: Maid of honor Amy Farrah Fowler's amazing behind-the-scenes wedding video, take one.

00:19:40:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:40:110000.Dialogue: We're just trying on dresses-- do we really need to record this?

00:19:44:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:44:130000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, are you the maid of honor?

00:19:57:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:57:150000.Dialogue: What are you, a nun? Come on, bestie, let's see some skin.

00:20:05:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:05:160000.Dialogue: You think they don't have mirrors in there? I know how I look.

00:20:30:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:30:110000.Dialogue: What is taking you so long?

00:20:33:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:33:070000.Dialogue: Oh, Amy! Get the hell out of here!
